meanings.definition: The condition of occurring in several different forms.
meanings.sent1: In nature, the polymorphism of certain insects allows them to adapt to various environments.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting showcased the polymorphism of colors and shapes.
meanings.sent3: The polymorphism of the puzzle pieces made it challenging yet fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe displayed a polymorphism of styles, from elegant to casual.
meanings.sent5: The polymorphism of the clouds created a breathtaking sunset sky.

meanings.definition: The quality of existing in multiple forms.
meanings.sent1: The polymorphism of the gemstone revealed different colors under various lights.
meanings.sent2: The concept of polymorphism in nature shows the diversity of living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The polymorphism of the building's architecture made it stand out in the cityscape.
meanings.sent4: His music collection had a polymorphism of genres, from classical to rock.
meanings.sent5: The polymorphism of the landscape changed dramatically with each season.

meanings.definition: The ability of a single interface to represent multiple data types.
meanings.sent1: The software's polymorphism allowed it to process different file formats seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: Understanding polymorphism in programming languages is essential for efficient coding.
meanings.sent3: The polymorphism of the virtual assistant made it capable of handling various tasks.
meanings.sent4: The concept of polymorphism in technology enables versatile applications.
meanings.sent5: The polymorphism of the algorithm optimized data processing for diverse inputs.
